string.text: Thank you for using my services. I've grown tired of being on the road. I'll sit down and have a rest ...
The motherfuckers, run quickly!
No time to explain! Come on, run! The military are planning a nuclear strike on the Generators!
What's going on, who are you?
Marked One, it's great that I found you!
Good luck.
Sidorovich, do you have some personal errands? I need money to repair my loot...
I'm always grateful for help with orders, but unfortunately, I have little. Here's what I can offer, choose:
No, no work for you yet.
Find the guitar.

Several newcomers arrived the other day, well, they wanted to drink vodka and sing some songs so they asked for my guitar. They begged and pleaded, they swore they would look after it ... In short, I gave it to them. But they were bunglers, they got as drunk as skunks and misplaced the guitar somewhere here in the camp; now they cannot find it because they don't remember a damn thing ... Marked One, can you try to find it? There's a reward, of course, not great, but the case is also a piece of cake. It's a pity because the guitar is in good condition, not broken at all. It has sentimental value. Ask stalkers in camp, may be someone knows something.
Do a deal with the military.

We've got planned a small deal with a friendly representative of the local military forces, so to speak ... In short, we give him a dozen artifacts, and for them we get - a batch of new weapons, unrecorded. The military command mistakenly sent them, and they as usual - said nothing, he he. It's necessary to deliver a container of artifacts to the military under the bridge and collect the weapons in exchange. The box will be heavy of course, but you won't have to carry it back. Use the Zaporozhets that we have here in the camp to bring back the box of weapons from the bridge, Okay? It will be easier on you and I won't have to nurse you back to health after you've injured your back. So that's the deal, try to do it professionally... Well, will you do it?
I'll take it, where is the container ...

That's good. So now go to Wolf - he'll give you the container. Bring the crate of weapons back to him.
Oh, and another thing: don't try to drive any other vehicle up to the military commander! I repeat, we have an arrangement that the messenger will come in a Zaporozhets. By the way, the rattletrap needs refuelling.
What, did you expect that everything would be laid out on a silver platter? Well, good luck!
 Almost forgot! Here's your reward for the flash drive.
Rescue the prisoner from the checkpoint.

We had a novice here who decided to take a stroll... He thought he'd found a recreational park!.. In short, he stumbled upon a military patrol. But for some reason they didn't shoot him, they took him back to the checkpoint. I recently received an SOS signal from him, he said that he managed to escape from captivity but ran the wrong way. Now, to come back, he has to go through the checkpoint again and he said he can't cope with that. Marked One, I suggest you send the soldiers at the checkpoint to hell and save the poor soul. Naturally I don't expect you to assault the checkpoint all on your own. I will organize a special squad of 10 fighters, together you will quickly overpower the soldiers. Well, what do you say?
So. Now I'll contact the special squad. They will wait for you to the east of the checkpoint, I threw their coordinates onto your PDA. You can go now. Good luck!
The military at the anomaly.
The military at the anomaly.
Determine why the military are at the anomaly.
Report to Sidorovich.

So. I've been given information that a group of about five soldiers are hanging around near the camp. They seem to be looking for something in the gully with anomalies ... We ought to find out what they're looking for, or have found which is unlikely. Otherwise they would have left. In General, go and reconnoitre and find out what you can. But in any case don't shoot at them, understand ?! We don't need extra problems with the military. Get down to business?
Mercenaries at the Cordon.

Recently, mercenaries were seen in the Cordon. They were moving north, and were later spotted in the forest at the Garbage. I was thinking: all this is no coincidence. We need to know what they are looking for. Generally you don't often see mercenaries here, they are clearly up to something. So I'm afraid we need to find out what their intentions are. Up to the challenge?
I'll take it. What do I need to do?

I've got an idea ... Let's say we listen to them. I'll give you a directional microphone, through which we will be able to record their conversation. What are you smiling at? You seem surprised that I can come up with some good ideas! In short this: you need to get as close as possible to the mercenaries, without making any noise, and turn it on. Go on, get out of here. Good luck!
Guest at the elevator.

In general, this is the job: I heard a whisper that two novices noticed how someone sits and smokes in the attic of the grain elevator near the bridge. Clearly, they faded out of harms way - it was a convenient place for an ambush, and they didn't want to catch a stray bullet. Now I can't sleep, with such a suspicious situation so close ... So find out what kind of mysterious guest had settled there and what the hell he's doing in the Cordon. Okay?
Hey Barkeep, which of my faults were you thinking about when you decided to get rid of me?

I ?! You ?! Don't give me that shit! Marked One, are you right in the head?! If I wanted you dead, you would not be standing here now and talking to me. Do you have reason to believe that I put a contract out on you?
You'll love this here (show the rifle).
Yikes! So that's it... Hmm...\nWhere did you find this gun?

Some guy at the Cordon tried to kill me with it, but after the first shot it exploded in his hands. The breach bolt shattered and blew off his head, so I couldn't ask him who he was working for. The rifle was lying beside the corpse. In your eyes I can see - you know something.

Yes, you're right - I do know something. Let me go on. I don't think anyone is hunting for you, Marked One. The stalker who shot at you - was a sniper, whom I hired to eliminate one man. It looks like he confused you with his real target.\nDamn it, now such turmoil will begin, you can't imagine...I'll be brief Marked One, and show you all my cards: It was necessary to have a stalker eliminated. It was ordered by serious people, and for a great deal of money. Apparently, this stalker seriously crossed their path. You understand, the customer didn't tell me all the details. I couldn't refuse him - it wouldn't have gone well for me. But at the same time, no one would have known that I had agreed. The contractor also had to go after the client.\nA local craftsman had made me some TNT cartridge. You know about these? A bullet fired from it flies in the same way as of conventional powder cartridge. But the explosion of TNT is so strong that it breaks the gun and kills the shooter. Everything would have turned out, but the sniper confused the target, the scumbag ...
You bastard, Barkeep! I'll use this same rifle and make you a cripple for life!

Listen, don't get angry! Calm down, Okay? I had no choice - you can't say no to those people ... Marked One, now you know - I could use your help. At the same time I will share with you - a "surprise" as compensation. In such affairs one doesn't put a figure therefore as a last resort I employ a hitman. Your task is to remove this killer. But pay attention! It must be done only if he eliminates his target. That way no one will be the wiser. Don't think I don't have good reasons to remove him: if you fail, and then come back to me, I won't discuss the matter...
But the reward must be worthy. What is the purpose? What's he done?

Yes it is. The stalker, as I understand it, found a passage to the Dead City. Fuck knows what deal he made to find out, but some people don't want him to get there. The passage, as I understand it, is through an old littered tunnel, and this dude planned to drag dynamite there so as to clear the blockage. The customer somehow found out about it and contacted me. I'm actually concerned myself, that he does not get there - that place is terrible, Marked One, there is nothing good to be found there... A passage through to there for us would be of no use, there is only crap to be found there... There you have it. Go now to the Cordon and remember: don't kill the assassin before he removes his target. So, I've forgotten nothing. And yes, I'm going to mark his position on your map.
I killed the sniper and his target is dead.
Thank you, Marked One, I never doubted you.
I'm on the job.
Which job?
About the guitar. I refuse to do it it.
About the guitar. Got it, here it is.
Well, thank you, Marked One! I got my guitar after all. Here's a small gift for you.
About the deal with the military. I refuse to do it.
About the deal with the military. It's done, "parcel delivered to the addressee," so to speak.
About the captive. I refuse to do it.
About the captive. I rescued him.
Good for you Marked One, well done! You kicked those warrior's asses! He he. Here's your well earned reward.
Thank you! I will go now.
While I was looking for the captive, I found this military report. Take, you may find it useful.
Thanks Marked One. I have yet to study the document. Here, take something else from me. A Medal of vigilance, so to speak.
As for the Soldiers at the anomaly. They found some artifact there, but are afraid to touch it.

Interesting ... Listen, get me that artifact! Maybe it's valuable - I should be able to sell it to the scientists and earn good money. Since the soldiers have not picked it up, quietly sneak in, grab it and bring it here. Look, only don't shoot the soldiers... at least not at first.
About the soldiers in the anomaly. I got the artifact.

Hmm, strange thing, very unusual. So rare. However, no benefit from it, as far as I know, but I will sell it to the scientists, and they will pay decent money for it. Take your share ... Good work! You - are a good fellow, you continue to please the old man...
About the soldiers in the anomaly. I refuse to do it.
About the Mercenaries at the Cordon. Well, let's hear what you managed to record...
About the Mercenaries at the Cordon. I refuse to do it.

Holy shit! They'll pay for this ... Can you imagine, those freaks planted a bomb somewhere in our camp! Resentful fucking assholes. I broke off selling them arms a month ago, you see, they want to kill me now, along with the entire camp. Marked One, help me out! We need to find the bomb urgently and defuse it. Do it, I'll pay! But hurry, Okay? I'm afraid it will blow up soon.
Roger, I'll look for the bomb.
About the Mercenaries at the Cordon. Everything is done: the bomb is defused, the mercenaries have been put down.
Thank you, Marked One, you saved the whole camp. And an old man ... whose life was tattered and moth eaten, so to speak, he he ... For good work a good reward! You deserve it.
About the Guest at the elevator. I completed it.
About the Guest at the elevator. I refuse to do it.
Well, what was there? Did you find something?
There was some guy there, he tried to shoot me down. But his first shot was his last - the rifle blew the hell out and killed him. Here's his rifle, look at this.

Hmm ... not a bad gun. Oh my, what's this scratch on the butt? ...\nHey, this is Barkeep's brand. This is clearly his rifle. Strange thing, he doesn't usually give anyone his weapons... It is necessary to find out who he was, where he got the rifle and who told him to shoot you. Go to Barkeep and show it to him. Consider it a task. I think you don't mind going there to get some explanations, he he.
To Barkeep? Okay, I'll kill the bastard!
I need to take your box with artifacts.
Yes, I know. Here you go. Carry this container of artifacts to the military, who are under the bridge, they are waiting. Pick up a box of weapons, and bring it back to me. That's all.
Whoa!
Here, I've brought a box of weapons.
Good for you, Marked One, good job. Go to Sidorovich for your reward.
It's about the deal. I've brought the container.
Show me ... So, yeah ... One, two, three ... uh huh ... uh huh ... five, ten, yes. All right.
Well, see you later.
Glad to hear it. Where is my box with the weapons?
Don't worry, I've already loaded it into your tumbled-down car.
Listen, you have the wrong vehicle. We need to put something in the trunk, but it won't fit.
In that case, it's time for me to go.

Don't worry, I have the box. Now remind those in the bunker: did they know that under the contract, you had to have to a particular vehicle to come here? I'll tell Sidorovich, why he was left without weapons. You are to blame.
It broke down, now it's just a useless pile of junk.
Well, if it is necessary, I'll get another one.

No, that will not do. I know the Zaporozhets, I sold it to him three months ago. And I have a contract with Sidorovich - All transportation is to be done with this machine, so I know what it's going to his people, and not some thug. Today, you drag the box to the bandits, and tomorrow we are ... under attack with our own weapons and you get away scot-free. No, that won't do.
Bite the bullet! You can't have one foot on each side of the fence.
--- Here is the text was not yet inserted. In general, the failure of this idiotic quest should be removed .--- Filon
The car is in place.
What "place"? Come over here.
Okay, now bring the box over.
So, I've freed a little space in the trunk.
All right, my soldiers have already loaded the crate into your car. You can go now.
Come on! We need more space. Throw out the trash.
So, where were we?
In fact, you gave me a bag.
Well, are you ready to make some noise?
Yes, we are ready. We can go.
Let's move out.
Hi! I've been looking for you. Why are you stuck here?

Phew, well, finally. I thought that I would have to hang around here forever. On the one hand - a portal, on the other - a military checkpoint, I didn't know which way to go. I fled here from the soldiers, but I went in the wrong direction, I was confused with fear.
Wow. Okay, let's go, I'll take you to the novice's camp
Hey soldier, what are you doing here?
Get out of here before you catch a bullet! None of your damn business.
I'm going, going ... just don't get nervous!
Come on... Can't we talk? I'm very interested!

The parasite is curious, and...don't you have anything better to do? Well, fuck it - we're tired of hanging around and not being able to leave. Do us a favour - bring a bottle of vodka, and some snacks with that... mmm... Well, let's say, three loaves of bread and two sticks of sausage. Then I can, enlighten you.
Here, two sticks of sausage and three loaves of bread. With vodka, as ordered. Well?
I don't have much food with me.
Too bad, then I have nothing more to say. Move on.

Oh, thank you ... Heh, I actually just wanted to have some fun with you ... Well, okay, quid pro quo. Our helicopter crews have complained that here, in this small sector, strong radio interference occurs. Well, we were sent here to find out why. We searched back and forth... in short, we found a strange artifact. It emits strong radiation, and when you get near it you start to feel strange - feeling sick and dizzy. Here we stand, protecting it from the hands of others - suddenly it has become valuable, heh. We could make some money then... Okay, now you can go. If we see you here again, you'll have problems.
Would you like me to help you get the artifact?

Well, actually, we wouldn't refuse your help... But that's one thing I don't understand: Why would you suddenly want to help us, knowing that you could catch a decent dose of radiation? Heh, by any chance, did you bump your head recently?
I've changed my mind.
Well, actually, it's not that simple....

Back to business... I decided to hit a jackpot. Well, why not. Go on, get out there and grab it for me, then I'll give you something useful for it. We have a special containment box, it will secure the artifact. And don't be silly, we are all nervous and sick of being here: try to steal it - and we will shoot you!
Okay, I'm going, I'll try to pick it up.
I got the artifact.
Wow! You look a little pale, are you okay? All right, hand it over before you start turning green.
Take it.
No, you can't have it. I picked it up, so I'm keeping it!

Well, thanks for helping, stalker. I didn't expect it. You saved us a lot of time while we waited for the research group in special suits to show up... I would have turned grey waiting here, heh! Here, take a bit of loot in gratitude from me.
Get out of here stalker, before you get shot!
Oh, what a nerve! I'm going, going ...
Hi! Why are you sitting there alone, why don't you come to the camp?

Well ... Fanatic is mad at me ... He gave me a task - to bring him a "Night Star" artifact urgently ... I failed. Now, because of me, he has problems and I cannot go back to camp. Fanatic is ferocious, he said: "I won't let you return until you bring the "Night Star", I'm very disappointed in you - and the customer is angry"... Just get one from somewhere, I don't care where. \n But I had thought it all out: I knew where to find the artifact, I waited a moment, then went to pick it up. I had gone thirty metres and saw how it glowed, I climbed through the bushes... And then suddenly a stalker hopped out of nowhere - grabbed my artifact and stuffed it into a container. At the same time: BANG! He caught a bullet. I looked - it was bandits. The reptiles waited until he pulled it out of the anomaly, then shot him. They hadn't noticed me hiding in the bushes, and after they shot him, I immediately took cover. They searched the poor guy, took the artifact away and went towards the Cordon. Well, I quietly followed them - hoping I might get the opportunity to steal their artifact container. But no - they went to the Darkscape at settled the gas station... I was afraid to get close to them, and catch a bullet. That's it. I didn't get the artifact from them, so I can't go back to camp. So I sit here alone...
Okay, well, see you later.
You know, I can help you.

You can? Listen, I'll be very grateful if you help. Go, try to get the artifact from the bandits. Perhaps you can persuade them so there's no need to take it by force - they don't carry valuable things around, for certain they've already hidden in a secret place somewhere. I'll throw the coordinates of the location on your PDA.
Good.
No, I changed my mind.
Halt simpleton! You've got balls! What are you doing here? On business, or are you tired of living?
Hmm, and Hello to you too. I'm here on business. I've heard you have "a Night Star" artifact here.
What we have is our business, and who are you, dickhead? You ask questions like a cop...
This artifact is needed by a serious man. I came to get it.
Well, fuck your crusade. Do you expect me to drop everything straight away? Get out of here while you still have your balls!
Come on, calm down, we're reasonable people. What do you want for it? Money?

No, the loot is not mine, but we can agree on a settlement. But I see you're a quick fellow ... Let's play for life. Not up to it, simpleton? If you guess the riddle, I'll give you the artifact, if not - we will shoot you, and we won't even bury you. Well then, we play?
I will not guess any riddles.
Well, tell your puzzle.

Now, listen, simpleton:\nThere are fifty lit candles in the room, clumsy Vladimir, the bent idiot, crashes into them and twenty blow out. How many candles will remain?\nLook, think carefully simpleton, don't miscalculate...
30 candles.
20 candles.
50 candles.
Dope... that's not right! A deal - is a deal. Hold on, simpleton, now we will cut you down.

You're right on! You guess was correct. In reality, the rest of the candles will burn down. I see that you're not just a fuck-up. Well, friend, we have been entertained. Okay, take your artifact and get out of here while I'm good in a good mood.
I'm leaving.
Thanks for the hospitality.
I got the artifact from the bandits, here you go.
Thank you brother, you helped me a lot. Take this from me, as thanks for your help.
... But how? How to do it? I can't imagine...
Hey man, what's wrong?
Sorry, but when I'm nervous, I talk to myself...
And the reason for this nervousness, if it's not a secret? However, it's none of my business, of course...

It's no big secret... Any help would be appreciated. Well, listen. I had a friend... his name was Figa. The other day, I met him in the territory of the Bar: you could see the fire in his eyes, his movements were sharp ... I realized at once - that Figa had discovered something interesting. Alright. He came across something unusual at Yantar and came looking for me, so we could go and reconnoiter together. I had just returned from a raid, and wanted to rest. The guy didn't want to wait, he said that he could cope alone. He never returned...
Hmm, sad story.
Listen ... Help me find my friend! Let's go to the factory together, together we can find him!
No, it's too dangerous, I can't help you.
I'd love to help, but how are we going to get there? The plant is full of mutant zombies! They'll send us to hell!
I'm racking my brain on how to get there quietly...
Quietly? In a crowd of zombies and snorks? Well, well, I think you should think further. But in this case. I won't do it.
Quietly you say ... I have an idea! I'll go to Sakharov, he may be able to suggest something.
Professor, is there a possibility to fool the zombies and mutants, so they don't attack people? I'm sure you have been asked this question before...

If you're wondering, this is a key point in ensuring the safety of our laboratory. Alas, detailed consideration has shown that: Mutants only attack objects whose aura lacks certain information. All the creatures have a "Learning Zone", so to speak. So the only way to avoid an attack - is to change the aura of the object. In a word, become a zombie. \nIncidentally, in the process of studying the impact of psi-emissions on living organisms, we have developed a serum in our laboratory that, when ingested by a human, creates an experimental zombie. It solved the problem of a shortage of biological material - you know, the mere trapping of mutants did not meet the needs of laboratory to the full. This serum increases the body's sensitivity to a range of psycho-waves, inducing a state of "light" zombification of the subject. It is noteworthy that the effect of the serum is only temporary and does not result in death of the animal. However, human trials have not yet been done, of course. Thus, the answer to your question: Theoretically it's possible, but it can have quite dangerous consequences for humans. Why are you interested?
Another stalker and I need to become zombies, it's very important. Help, please, Professor.

A strange request... I should dissuade you from this idea... But I'm afraid if I don't help you, then you are likely to succumb to radiation and become a zombie. This wouldn't end well... Okay, I will prepare the desired serum for you. But for that, I need a sample of water from the lake at Yantar: I've run out of suitable samples, and this eliminates the need for replenishment - our research has moved to a new level.
What kind of water is it? And where can I get it?

This water contains unusual neurotoxins formed during prolonged exposure to radiation. In any case, you shouldn't drink it, as it causes reactions that increase the susceptibility to the influence of psi. Not to mention the inevitable content of various impurities, including poisons. Bring it to me, and I will prepare a serum for you, the use of which will cause you to go into state similar to that of a zombie, but only temporarily. You can get the water from a small swamp not far from here, near the crashed helicopter.
I'll get you the water.
Wait, don't rush. I'll give you a flask for the water. Be careful, that swamp is not safe.
I got the water. Here you go.
So, let me have a look ... Yes, that's what I need, the water is perfect for the preparation of the serum.\nNow I'll mix all the necessary ingredients and the serum will be ready.
[Wait]

The serum is ready. Once you take the drug, you may become ill. It's not dangerous and will change within a minute. When the serum wears off, zombies will attack. Be careful not to miss the moment of the serum's expiration.
Thank you.
Well, were you successful?
Shall we get on with it? Let's drink the serum! I'll be right behind you.
All right, all right.
Listen, I seem to have found a way to get into the factory!
How?
Sakharov produced a serum which will turn us into temporary zombies. While we're in this state, zombies and snorks will leave us alone.
Dumb idea, but damn it, let's try. There doesn't seem to be any other way. You have the first drink and I'll have the remainder.
All right, now.
I think... we have... a chance. We can go... to the factory... to look for Figa...
Come on... hurry!..
Ha ha ha!... Ah Ha Ha Ha!..
Figa!.. Can you talk?... Do you know... Chuck?..
Chuck!... Brother!... Good to see him... Hmm...
The Secret... Of Yantar... Tell me?..
Yes... Cache... Territory... Bar, where the fuzz... fuzz burns... painfully... Big safe...
Hold on... let me... help you... get out... we have... to go.
I'm dying...
Strelok... thank you... You go... I'll stay!.. I need... to bury Figa... while I'm still... a zombie...
Don't stay... here for too long... you'll die...
Hi! What are you doing here? Who are you?
Clearly, you have troubled look. Do you want to ask something?
I'm - Dead Stalker. I'm known by this nickname because I look like a corpse, having spent so much time in the dungeons.
How did you get there?
Long story, are you interested?
Yes, I found some documents... Project "C-Consciousness", heard anything about it?
Found? Really ... Let me guess, Sample "O-21"?
How do you know about that?

I was part of those awful experiments. During the experiment, our minds were merged, completely losing our individual will... And believe me, I was not happy with all this. We experienced strange pressure on our minds, sometime later. Almost all the test subjects became thoroughly addicted with the obsession - to create an ideal world, becoming Gods in it. It seemed the only way they could achieve this - was to give up their identities, and merge into a single super being. This idea to us was intentionally introduced to us, it seems tried to make our brains something like a very powerful computer, having turned us into an impersonal appendage. It was terrifying, I struggled and resisted. But what could I change? I had barely enough strength to struggle to cling on to the fleeting remnants of myself... I resisted as well as I could - but my head went to pieces at the same time: I have seen such horrific hallucinations that I've screamed in terror and wanted to die. My mind saw fragments of the future - I saw the Zone, long before it appeared. But the heartless scientists, who only saw us as lab rats, decided that my psyche was not strong enough to withstand the experiment, transferred me here - to the X-18.\n So I came here, and kept my mind. I don't know what happened to the rest. And yet, this group of scientists had created a sample of "O-21" that you found...
An atrocity.

Oh, do not say ... But "O-21" is a beautiful trap, which has some kind of donor relationship with the C-Consciousness. With it you think clearer and have better ideas, but it can drive you crazy, infecting your brain with notions about the "ideal world." But the longer you interact with it, the worse you will be... I sometimes call myself, "Seeing Stone" because of it.
What should we do with it?

Well, we should - destroy it. It's too dangerous. But that is not so simple. The sample material is only halfway complete, and trying to destroy it, won't work. However, there is a place where it can be destroyed. I have no idea where it is, and certainly can't imagine what it's called. But I can clearly see its outlines: somewhere in the rocky terrain is an anomaly, like a small pool. It seems there was an evacuation attempt nearby, but apparently it was unsuccessful ... I see a half-destroyed bus, abandoned vehicles and construction equipment. This anomaly - was one of the first in the area and is very strong. It is able to consume "O-21", destroying it without a trace. Although, you know, you can make a choice. Some have sold the soul of this sample.
I'll find this place and destroy the artifact.
Well, good luck, Stalker!
Well, it's over. I destroyed Sample "O-21".

Destroyed? Really. This is great news. I didn't even believe that you would succeed. Lucky you.\nBy the way, I forgot to tell you. Those records that you found in Professor Thompson's cache are very important to the scientists. I advise you to give these records to Sakharov. Maybe the scientists can decipher some very important data from the records. And you can get a good reward.
No, I better hold on to these notes.
Well, I'll take these notes to Sakharov.
Well, as you wish. In your place, I would take these notes to the scientists immediately.\nThank you once again for destroying Sample "O-21". I'm very grateful.
Have a good trip. \nThank you once again for destroying Sample "O-21". I'm very grateful.
I brought you some of professor Thompson's notes. Perhaps they will be useful.

Let me see... Hmm... These records reveal a lot of detail about what happened in the X-16 lab here at Yantar. I'll study them. Thank you very much, Strelok. Take this device as a reward for the information, it will useful to you in the Zone. It detects all forms of life. If you need additional life-form signatures for it, I always have the firmware in stock.
Wisher: Find the missing piece of code.
Find the missing piece of code.
Wisher said that the missing part of the code can be found in the house where I originally found Minor.
"Monolith"'s PDA.
Password for the Radar.
Password to deactivate the bomb in the control room at the Radar - 14539782568.
Is it suitable?
Hurry up, so I don't die instantly, the City is full of zombies.
Yes, just right!
Well, let's go.
Well, I'll see what I have so I could give you a weapon.
Uh, thank you for saving me. I thought I'd be stuck here forever. We need to get out of here before the "Monolith" spot us. Are you coming?
Damn, look again, maybe you have something more decent?
I rescued you for a reason. I was told that you know the second part of the code from the briefcase.

Well, stalker, thank you for saving me. Write down the second part of the code, it sounds like this: "2568".\nNow listen carefully. You already know that if you turn off the switch, the trap is triggered. The first part of the password you have, the second I gave you. Before turning off the main switch don't forget to enter the password into the computer, located in front of the circuit breaker.\nGoodbye, and good luck to you.
Excellent, thank you!

Ah, so you're the one! Yes, I know the second part of the code. But first, let's get far away from this place, I need to get to go to the Military Warehouses, and then I'll tell you the second part of the password. Just give me a weapon, I've been without one for a long time, and I have no ammunition left.
Yes? Is there something you wanted to say?
Yeah, thank you and good luck!
Hey!
Yeah, it's a little problem. Okay, wait, don't despair. Maybe I'll think of something.

They call me Minor. This building is a spatial trap. It's impossible to get out of here, I'm worn out trying. Every time I try, I get thrown back. I've been sitting here for more than a day. Damn it, I came looking for artifacts, and like an idiot, got stuck here. It looks like we're stuck here together now. Do you have any food? We could last a little longer.
How come you're here? Who are you, and what's going on?
Oh, Hey! You shouldn't have come here, buddy. You won't get out of here now. Now there're two of us, I'm not so afraid to die.

Plans have changed, the agent wasn't there, he didn't arrive at the appointed time. His last communique came from the Dead City. This is a dangerous place, I have a suspicion that something is wrong here. It is in our best interest to rescue the agent. Beware of the "Monolith", their spies operate throughout the City.

Perfect! Well, just great! You didn't save Minor, damn it, it's necessary to improvise. Well, what happened, happened. If you need the missing portion of the code - look in the house where Minor was supposed to be.
Listen, man, the medkit won't help, I will die anyway, but promise me that you'll perform my last request! I beg you!
Of course I will! Ask.
Man, I'm sorry, but I'm too busy, I can't help you.

Thank you. I believed that there were good people in this world. So, we, that is, Bulrush and I, were returning from a raid. The amount of loot was - absurd. Earlier I had a bad premonition... Then it happened. We were on our way to Sidorovich, we only had a little way to go when Bulrush shot me in the back. I lost consciousness, and he thought I was done for, so he took the loot and disappeared. I pulled myself together, sent a SOS signal SOS, and to my relief, you arrived. Listen, find this reptile and take my share away from him. No need to kill him, just take my share and send it to my wife. My daughter is sick. She needs surgery. Because of Bulrush, this would be my last raid. The money is just enough. I beg you, for God's sake, send the money to my wife. Here's my PDA, it has the address where you can send money ... Do it!
Hey, hey, stalker, hold on... Now I'll give you something...
Oh, Marked One, finally you came. I've been waiting for you.
You said you had a small job?

Yes it's a breeze. A lone stalker wound up here... a very suspicious person, with a no less suspicious appearance. We saw him at the farm in the Dark: sitting Valley, frowning as if contemplating something, and went to the factory three timed that day.
So, what's so strange about that? Can't a stalker go to the factory?

It's not that. There, at the factory in the Dark Valley, we spotted some movement - maybe mercenaries or monolith had settled there. We couldn't get a better look at what he was up to - he moved across enemy territory, then disappeared. But that's not all. The same stalker was seen repeatedly under the bridge at the military checkpoint. There he talked with Kuznetsov about something. \n... In general, dark doings, Marked One. I don't like it. After the military raid on the bandit's base in the Dark Valley everything settled down, and the military became more active there - Kuznetsov has already sent soldiers to the base three times that was unscheduled. Here and there groups of soldiers intersect. Helicopters are circling like they're looking for something.
So-oo. As soon as I leave you alone, you start to brew up something. Let me guess: this job is tied up with what you're brewing? Is it not?

No, not at all! I told you it was easy - Just follow the stalker as he goes back and forth. See what he does at the factory. If the soldiers under the bridge are not angry with you, then try to talk with Kuznetsov, he can tell you interesting things. Tell me the results. The size of your reward depends on the results. In any case, Anyway I won't offend, you know me.
I know I know. Well, I'll try.
Look, Sidorovich, did a certain Bulrush come here?
Why? You know, I never give out customer's names. Well, almost never.
That's right, almost. I need this man, Sidorovich. He shot his partner so he could steal their loot.
Where did you get this information?

His partner, that Bulrush mortally wounded, the poor man stayed alive long enough to tell me. He was saving the money for his daughter's operation. His last raid was indeed his last. I promised to fulfil his last request - to get his share of the money from Bulrush, and send it to his widow.

Well, yes, of course! If you want, I can tell you a dozen similar stories. They will bring a tear to your eyes - even hardened criminals have cried... This is not your first day in the Zone, Marked One! I am amazed how you believe in such nonsense?
Here, look - The stalkers PDA...
Convinced?

Okay. Let us assume that I believe you. But all the same, if you don't perform a task I gave you, I won't tell. The information can be payment for your labour. Or pay the money. One thousand two hundred. Ha-ha.
Well, you toad, Sidorovich!
But, but ... You do it, so don't get cocky. And yet, how could it be otherwise? In my profession, it happens all the time.
How business?
I'm not accountable to you. Do you want to pay for passage? Then pay. So come on, hurry.
Oh ... And I've got some vodka. Let's drink to the valiant military.
Vodka, you say? Well, so should have said so sooner. We certainly could use a drink.
Here it is, major. So what can you tell me? How's things?
Worse than ever. The administration has started something, and there making us all nervous.
What are they doing?
I can't tell you. All I can say, is that things will start to heat up very soon.
You really won't tell me? Is it not a Military secret?
All the same, I still can't say. I didn't tell you anything. What I blurted out, was superfluous!
Okay, okay, don't get angry. And how are things with the stalkers? They bother you, I suppose?

And how. There's a loner who comes here, begging rounds. Many come begging. Here I am, at the same time, a soldier with a requisition for more ammo. The main warehouse keeps asking us why we require so many supplies.
You be careful, or they will close you down.
I have the same feeling.
Well, good luck to you. I've got to run.
Come, let's talk.
Where's my gear? Who put me here? What's going on?

Don't panic. I'll tell you everything. So, in case you haven't noticed, there are a lot of strange things happening in the district. There is a reason for this - the military are planning a special major operation. Frankly, I don't know what they intend to bring into the Zone, but it has the "Monolith" running scared. In general, they see this as a direct threat to the Zone and to their own very existence. Therefore the "Monolith" are planning a counter operation whose main objective – is not to allow the device to pass into the Zone. The mercenaries pursue a somewhat different cause - they don't care about the Zone, they just want to steal the device - apparently to fill somebody's order. Thus, the interests of two powerful groups are met, and, most importantly, they don't contradict, but complement each other.
Now I know, however. Let's deal with this. We'll have to think - what to do about it. Come on. How do you know all this? How did you get involved, and why did you go to military under the bridge?

I got involved in the most direct way. I was hired for a lot of money to play the role of "negotiator", so to speak. There is this one guy, with the military under the bridge. Alexander Ovechkin - he's in good standing with Kuznetsov. Whether monolith or mercenary, this clown couldn't tell them apart, but he managed to recruit them – I don't know how, but for a "mole", he's doing well. I had come for cartridges. Kuznetsov sent someone to the base and while I waited for the order, Ovechkin was supposedly talking peacefully with me on the sidelines. In fact, he gave me all the necessary information. Sometimes Kuznetsov sent Ovechkin to the base. That's when I got to know the latest facts "first hand." Getting cartridges was a needed distraction for him to get information. Well that, and to a lesser extent, to strengthen the combat potential of mercenary and monolith troops..

I had fun with you. Now for the big question. Why the hell are you telling me all this? What's the catch? I'm about to be executed, and you have decided to tell me the truth before this monumentous event?
No catch. Think of it like this – I woke up with a conscience. Yes, don't laugh. You see, once upon a time I defended people.
Where you a cop?

Sort of. I have not worked in my profession for many years, I turned a blind eye to all that was happening around me. But now - it's over. I don't do this anymore. There's too much turmoil now to ignore. After all, if the "Monolith" are frightened of that damn thing the military has dragged in the Zone, it's possible to assume that it's some sort of weapon. And a powerful weapon at that. If this military weapon fell into the hands of the mercenaries or anyone else, it could cause a lot of problems. This cannot be allowed to happen.
Listen, do you really believe that ... How many of them? Twenty, thirty?
Thirty. A total of thirty.

Well... Do you believe, that thirty people can cause enough damage to the entire military expedition? Surely the soldiers will have helicopter gun-ships and BTRs to protect them... And their number of personnel ... is not small.

If only it were so simple. The "Monolith"s are cunning pricks, they've dug up some psi-unit from an unknown underground laboratory. I don't know in what condition it was, or whether they had to fix it, but it works. And it works only on mutants. the "Monolith" say that all they need. Mutants have always been abundant in the Dark Valley and the Garbage. Install the unit in the right place, they can provoke a so-called "rutting season". Have you ever seen it?
I heard of it, but never seen it.
Well, I have. I can assure you, the "Monolith" will have a certain advantage. All that will remain of the expedition will be a few body parts. This is very dangerous shit, that the mercenaries have.
What do you suggest? Once you have freed me, you have a plan, I hope?
No, no plan as such. But there is a goal that must be achieved - we must disrupt the plans of the mercenaries and monolith.
Commendable. First. I need my gear returned. Secondly - it is necessary to warn the military. I doubt that the two of us can overcome thirty well-trained fighters alone.
At the factory, they're not up to strength. There's just some top-brass and a dozen fighters.
Whatever. All the same, it's an unnecessary risks. We need to find a simpler way. But it's necessary that military believe us. Any idea where we can get evidence that they are preparing an ambush?
The chief of the mercenaries has a laptop. Surely there is enough stored entertaining information. You'll find all your gear in Borov's box.
Clear. I need to get my belongings before we enter the factory. You distract the main mercenary, and I will try to grab the laptop from his desk.

Move. There's a dead bandit up ahead, take his suit and then you can go for your things. Then we'll move to the factory. I will say that you are my assistant, because that amount of ammo is heavy to lug around by yourself.
Okay!

So, we're almost there. Follow me and stay close. I'll take you into the mercenaries main office, well, you know what to do - you pinch the laptop and then we get the hell out of there. Then we'll tell the military everything. Got it?
It's urgent we notify military command that the convoy with the cargo will be attacked.
Are you crazy? Who would believe me? And why should I believe you?
Here's the laptop of the advance party commander of mercenaries and monoliths. It contains more evidence than you think.
Um ... Jeez!
Report it! What are you waiting for? Your "secret operation" will most invariably end in failure, and that damn thing you're transporting, will fall into the hands of the mercenaries.
Damn, damn, damn! I'll try to contact them on the radio, you go ahead and meet them, then reconnoitre the road.
Well, here we go again. Run.
Don't kill me, Marked One. I didn't do anything!
Not guilty? Didn't you kill Swift? Am I right? Why did you do that?
I was overcome by greed. I don't know what came over me. Well, don't kill me!
Did you know that his daughter was ill, and Swift was saving the money for her? Did you?
No, of course not... If I had, I never would have touched him!
Yeah, however you did ... Talk! Where are the goods?
Mercy?
I'll think about it.
Okay, I tell you! I hid the loot in (several options). I'll give you everything! Spare my life! Are you going to kill me?
I'm still thinking. Tell me why you killed the soldier?

They said, I was to wait in the attic of the grain elevator and if I saw this soldier on the road – they thrust a photo under my nose – I was to shoot him. Most likely you won't be needed, we are using you as insurance. They gave me a thousand rubles. They said if I sat in ambush, they would double it. And if shot the soldier, then four. I agreed, of course. So what? Spare me?
No, scum, you cannot live.
All right, live. But mind you, if I ever hear about you doing that shit again, don't hope for mercy! Take this medkit and fuck off out of here!
Barkeep, I have a simple job for you. I need to send some money to this address.
No problem, I can send it.
Thanks.
I'm on the job. About shadowing the stalker.
Speak come on, don't wait. Did you manage to find out anything?

That stalker, I was following, is helping the mercenaries with something. The military has a big operation going on - they are bringing into the Zone that the "Monolith" didn't like. They and the mercenaries want to intercept the soldiers importing the object.\nDuring the shadowing, I was spotted and captured, but this mysterious stalker saved me. He helped me prevent the mercenary's ambush. I stole their laptop and showed it to the military.
Marked One, you have a talent for getting involved in problems. Well, for your troubles, you get a really notable loot.
loot loot, what about Bulrush? You promised to help me, you bald bastard!

You've become arrogant, Marked One. He left here all emboldened and went to some deserted basement in an abandoned factory, you see. All right... I heard that the fellow you're looking for was hanging around here, he'd returned from raid and was boasting about his loot. He soon managed to relax - got drunk, poked his nose where it didn't belong, then came across a patrol of soldiers. So, if you want to find out, if or where he can be found, go to the checkpoint.
Take me to the compound where Mole and the diggers are camped - It'll be safe there.
Okay, I'll help you, let's get out of here before the special forces arrive.
You know, I didn't come here to save you...
Break through. We'll break through - together. Everything will be fine. Only let's go. Yes, we'll get there. I know it. Come on, what are you waiting for?

Thank you, stalker, I'll never forget what you have done! Listen, I have nothing with me, but Barkeep will pay you with interest, I promise. He owes me a lot. Okay, then I'll head off to Duty. I hope we meet again someday.
Well, good luck to you, Tramp.
Marked One, hello!

Good morning! I am - the commander of the rescue unit, ordered to pick up and evacuate the Stalker prisoner going by the name of Signalman. If the operational report from headquarters is to be believed, you are the person who volunteered to rescue the prisoner. Am I right?
Yes, I am the stalker, about whom you speak.
That's good. However, where is the prisoner?
I'll get him.
We can't stay here for long. So I advise you to hurry.
Yes yes, I know that.
Well Marked One, where's the promised Signalman?
Soon, a little patience.
I see you brought the prisoner. That's good. Finally, we can escort him to our base.\nYou're free, your help is no longer needed here. Your reward can be obtained from Barkeep.
Well, I'm glad to help.
Stalker, I've already told you that your help is not needed. You're free to go.
Got it, I'm leaving.

Hello, stalker! Command left us here to protect this area from mutant scum and insolent bandits. However, we will shoot ordinary extremists with great pleasure. So, don't play pranks here, understood?
Oh, Marked One, why didn't you save Signalman? He was a good man known by all stalkers, he kept the network up and running...
Healing: Talk with Sakharov
Talk to Sakharov about the disease

Sidorovich managed to get sick. Unfortunately it's quite bad: he has high temperatures, gut-wrenching lung coughs and other "joys" of life. It seems strange, as he doesn't leave the bunker - well, only very seldom when absolutely necessary. Maybe, he has no immunity to germs? But that's okay, we'll find out afterwards, but for now I'll go to Sakharov - maybe he can suggest something sensible.
Healing: Find professor Preobrazhensky
Find Preobrazhensky

After the conversation with Sakharov it became clear that he knows very little about the disease, however, he advised to find his colleagues - Professor Preobrazhensky. He threw the coordinates onto my PDA - all that remains, is to find a scientist.
What's happened to Sidorovich? The door is locked, and someone inside is coughing...
Sidorovich got sick. Very sick. I don't even know if he'll make it...
What kind of sickness? What are his symptoms?
He says he has a headache, his body aches, has a temperature over forty and is coughing up blood.
It doesn't look good... You look after him, while I go to Yantar and speak with the scientists. Maybe Sakharov can advise what to do...
So be it, I'll nurse that old bastard. But he's still a jerk!
Come on, good luck!
Of course Sidorovich can sometimes be a redneck when it comes to money, but he's a good man. He helps novices, and, by the way, he helped you too. Have you forgotten?
I would have survived without his help. He only helped me because I performed a few tasks for him. Okay, I'll go now, and share the good news with others.

Even so ... You're right. He did help me ... So now, I'll help him. You stay here and take care of him while I go to Yantar and speak with the scientists. Maybe Sakharov will come up with something...
We need your expert help. Do you know anything about diseases?

What sort of diseases are you interested in? If they are common ones, I can help. If it's any specific disease caused by the Zone, it's unlikely. My colleague, professor Preobrazhensky is engaged in studying viruses from the Zone, in more detail.
I'll tell you the symptoms, and you tell me, if this disease is common or "specific".
Go on.
Headaches, body aches, temperature over forty and coughing up blood.
My colleague recently studied something like this. If you want, I'll give you his coordinates, - he's now engaged in field studies.
Yes, of course. The person is at deaths door.
So, give me your PDA... Everything is ready, I've noted his location on your map. If I'm not mistaken, my colleague was accompanied by two volunteer stalkers.\nWell, good luck. Have a nice search!
Thank you, Professor!
Are you one of them?
No, I'm on my own.
How did you find me? Confess! I know you're one of them! Release me!

Calm down. I'm not one of them, whoever they were. I just found you - I heard some shooting and decided to see what was happening. You see, my friend, I really need your help. Were you the one responsible for studying viruses in Sakharov's laboratory?
Yes I was.
I have an important question for you...
So. Hold on with your questions. Did Sakharov send you?

To some extent. I need an expert on viruses. The professor said that you are doing research into this, and gave me the coordinates of your camp. By the way, here's your PDA. I found it near... Heh, your now "former" camp.
Thank you very much. It contains very important scientific data.
So, will you answer my questions?
Take me to the Dark Valley - to the entrance from the Darkscape, then I will help you.
All right. Come on.
Are you ready to help me now?
Sure.

An indispensable and very influential person has just got sick. His symptoms include: severe headaches, aching body, temperature above forty and coughing up blood. Sakharov said that you recently come across something similar.

The Professor is right. About a month ago two diggers, came to the laboratory and brought us a gas cylinder. There were biological hazard warning signs on it. The stalkers were confused. We purchased the gas cylinder, and I began to study its contents. As it turned out, there was a virus inside. It's called... I won't give you its long scientific name. For my own reference, I baptized it "boar flu", "avian fever", "bloodsuckers itch" - or something like that. The structure of the virus clearly indicates that its origin is artificial. To find a vaccine under normal circumstances, I think would take a decade, but fortunately, there is one in the Zone now. At about that time, I had studied a very curious and extremely rare plant: Ranunculus insolita. What do you think? Even a small amount of its juice is enough to completely destroy the cells of the virus! A "vaccine" for humans has already passed tests. A week after the diggers left the lab, a stalker showed up. He said that he breathed in some muck in one of the laboratories and had those same symptoms that you have listed. Blood tests showed that the number of units of the virus, read off the scale. Three injections killed the virus, and in a day the stalker was completely cured.
Do you have this plant juice?
Not anymore. It's quite impossible to keep - it's perishable. But I do know where to find it.
Go on.

If I understand correctly, it grows near water. The very first time I found it, was in the swamps near the Army Warehouses. There was some crazy sitting there and screaming all the time, he even tried to shoot me.\nBut that's irrelevant. Bring me three stalks, and I will make a vaccine. But remember, it will only help if it's less than three days since he caught the infection. After that, the process of destruction of the body is likely to be irreversible.
Wait, I'll be right back.
Here, three stalk as you requested. Prepare the medication.
Meanwhile, why not talk with Sakharov, maybe he has some work for you... Recently, the snorks in the swamp have become very active.
Is it ready?
Yes, everything is ready. Administer it intramuscularly three times, at five hour intervals.
Thank you, doctor!
It's a pleasure. I owe you my life.
Well, it was no big deal... Okay, I got to run. Goodbye.
Well, how are you? Feeling better?
Much. My nose is still runny, but it doesn't matter.
That's good, you really had us worried... But I wonder, how did you pick up such a nasty virus?
The fact of the matter is that I didn't pick it up, it was given to me.
How so?

Some kind of stalker wearing a brown cloak came here, and said, well, he was delivering a gift someone had sent me, and puts a box on the counter. I asked, how much is this going to cost me? And he says: nothing at all. A man, who wishes to remain anonymous, presents you with a gift completely free, you have nothing to pay. I thanked him and he left. Well, out of interest I opened the cover of the box and something inside hissed, then the cellar filled with gas. I didn't have time to realise what was happening. I think he played me for a sucker. That evening I was laid up with fever and was shaking with an intolerable cough.
So, one of your competitors sent you the virus?
Seems so...
Do you remember any distinguishing features? Or a name?

Nothing special, he just looked like any other stalker. He was dressed in a brown cloak. I don't remember his name. But I do remember that it began with a "B" and it reminded me of something like mushrooms.
This is going badly for Sidorovich. But I'll still try to find the villains. In the meantime, I'll tell the guard not to let strangers in. Certainly they won't rest.
Wait a minute. You've saved my life. I will never forget this.
Thank you.
Did two diggers bring you a gas cylinder about a month ago?
Yes, they did.
Do you don't know where those stalkers went then? Or, at least, where they found the gas cylinder?

Where they found it - I don't know, they didn't say, but they were going to go to the X-16 laboratory. However, if they really went there, then most likely, there remained.I have no confidence in their training... Unlike yours, Marked One. Do you want to help science once again? I need monster tissue samples for experiments.
Sorry, Professor, I don't have time. I need to check out the X-16...
Bulrush? Why did you poison Sidorovich?
He was poisoned? I only gave him a gift!
Don't play me for a fool! In the box that you gave him, was a spray with a deadly virus!
The stalker named Snake asked me to deliver a gift to Sidorovich. He said I would be well paid. He didn't disappoint me...
Okay, I'll believe you. But first tell me where I can find this Snake?
The last time I saw him was in the building at the gas station, in the Dark Valley. Perhaps, you know the place?
I know it. Here's a medkit, and don't pass any more suspicious types of gifts!
Sure, sure. If I had known, I never would have!
See ya.
Are you Snake?
Well, I am. What do you want?
Why would you want to poison Sidorovich?
What do you mean, "wanted"? I did poison him. I'm not trying to hide it. First, he's getting long in the tooth. Second, I found a worthy replacement.
Are you out of your mind?
What could I... the customer is waiting at the Cordon. By the way, could you can tell him I said Sidorovich is finished? I can't be bothered going myself. Not for free, of course.
No, Snake. Sidorovich survived. I found medicine for him. But a cure for a bullet in the head, has not been found.
Come on. I'm going there anyway.
Great. Well then, his name is Crafty. I have a message for him. Tell him this: "the bastard is dead". Can you remember that?
Of course. "The bastard is dead". It's simple.
Here's a thousand up front, when you get back, you'll get even more.
Hi, Crafty. I have a message for you from Snake. "The bastard is dead!"
Well, everything went smoothly. I can now safely take the place of that bastard. He-he ...
Yeah, you will take his place. Sidorovich survived, I found medicine for him. But you won't live, you louse.
This is a cure for Sidorovich. The scientists made it. It should help.
Thank you, Marked One. If it helps, I don't even know how to thank you!
Barkeep, do you have any personal errands for me?
Of course, Marked One, I always have assignments. Dangerous, but well paid. Here, you choose which one.
Barkeep's friend.

I have a friend, he is somewhere in the Dark Valley with his group. They're monitoring the bandits and sending back information. But the last couple of days, my friend suddenly stopped communicating, even though his PDA is transmitting. Marked One, go there, and find out what happened. I'll give you the coordinates of his last location. Will you do it?
Shvidi's PDA

Record №1:
Yesterday we saw three bandits capture a Duty member. Those freaks!
Record №2:
The bandits are obviously becoming impudent! According to our data, they've already captured several Duty members.
Record №3:
Today was lucky - we found three chunk of meat artifacts.
Record №4:
We crossed paths with Freedom, but we managed to repulse them.
Record №5:
Our group was captured by Freedom, they took away our weapons. They want to take us to a small tower next to the trailer and force us to get the artifacts. They don't want to climb up there themselves - there is strong radiation. We are trying...
Stalker! Help - we have been captured. We're being held in a trailer, but there is a window! Quietly and carefully come to the window so we can talk...
Marked One, well done! You found my friend. Try to rescue him!
Duty's deal with the mercenaries.

In general, here's the story. A week ago, Duty clashed with the mercenaries. They usually like to remain neutral, but this time something happened. During the shoot-out, a detachment of Duty was defeated and the squad commander was taken prisoner. Duty then contacted the mercenaries and demanded the return of the captured commander. The mercenaries agreed, but only for a very large ransom. They had no choice, the commander was an experienced man and Duty couldn't afford to lose him - so an exchange was planned. You need to keep an eye on what's happening and, if things don't go according to plan - you never know what could happen - support Duty with cover fire. Begin by talking with the ensign, he will tell you what to do next. How about it?
Prisoner at the military base.

A very dangerous situation has developed, Marked One. The military captured one of our experienced stalkers, our messenger. The problem is that he participated in the creation of the stalker communication network, and he knows all the data encryption codes for the stalker PDAs. He is a good fellow, strong and silent, but it won't be long before he cracks. The military are going to get him out of the Zone and send him to specialised interrogators, they are sure to find methods to squeeze out every drop of information from him. All this is very bad, Marked One. If this information reaches the mainland, it will become a disaster for us. It won't be possible to go fishing for artifacts in the Zone for a long time. I'm afraid we have few choices - it's necessary to save the guy, and quickly. Or, if you really have no other choice - kill the guy. As reported by the scouts, he is now in the main building being interrogated; they occasionally catch glimpses of him through the windows. Will you take it?
That's good. Go to the "Agroprom" Research Institute. I'll get back to you, if the situation changes.
Resolve the situation with the prisoner at the Agroprom

The military at the Agroprom have captured a stalker who has some very important information. If this information reaches the mainland, it would have disastrous consequences for everyone in the Zone, except the military. It's necessary to rescue or liquidate the captive in the shortest possible time.
Reach the Agroprom
Save or eliminate the prisoner
Back to Barkeep
Signalman
Save the captive

It's necessary to escort Signalman to the factory where diggers were based - there, he will be safe. Well, at least military if don't guess he's there and send special troops by helicopter to the Garbage.
Take the prisoner to a safe location
Safe place
The commander of the rescue team
Talk to the detachment commander
Hi, Barkeep. I have completed this mission.
Hi, Barkeep. I have completed this mission.
Hi, Barkeep. I refuse to carry out this mission.
Duty's deal with the mercenaries. I have completed this mission. The mercenaries staged an attack, but I was able to rescue the captive.
Debt deal with the mercenaries. I refuse to carry out this mission.
That's well done, good work. I congratulate you on the success of the task and I'll give you a well-deserved reward.
Prisoner at the military base. I have completed this mission.
Well. Too bad, of course, that you couldn't save Signalman. He was a good man, dammit. It's a real shame. Mmm, look, we'll have to replace him... Okay, may he rest in peace. Take the reward and go.

Well, Marked One! Thank you so much for saving Signalman. Without him, our stalker network - would be useless. Wow, it's scary to imagine what would have happened if his data fell into the hands of the military. So, here's your reward - you deserve it!
Prisoner at the military base. I refuse to carry out this mission.
Max, do you have any personal errands for me?
No problem. Here's what I can offer you:
Help Freedom at the radar.

We've had an experienced fighter who decided to show his bravery by going to the Red Forest at the Radar to search the downed helicopter. We tried to stop him, but he was determined, and at night left for the Radar. They say there is something useful there. We are definitely interested in this helicopter, but we don't want to risk the life of one of our experienced guides. He's been gone two days, and I am very concerned. Marked One, take a trip out to the helicopter, and check it out... Is our hero alive, or does he need to be buried? If he's alive, bring him back - I hope he hasn't become a zombie. In the last couple of days, the radiation from the Brain Scorcher has weakened, but it won't last long.
Help Freedom at the radar. I have completed this mission.
Help Freedom at the radar. I refuse to carry out this mission.
Thank you Stalker, for rescuing him. Without you he would have died.
Hi, Grandpa. What are you doing here? Why so sad?

Hello Stalker. Yeah... I don't know what to do... Ah, if it wasn't for my poor health and old bones, I would go to Pripyat - I want to find my daughter. And then there's the military! The are unhelpful - they won't give me a pass.
And what happened to your daughter?

I used to live in Pripyat with my only daughter, Tanya. She was 10 years old and in third grade at school. I worked in the turbine halls of the third and fourth units at Chernobyl. I'm a turbine specialist... All was well, and we lived happily. And then the accident happened at Chernobyl. I was unlucky, I was on the night shift - and close to the fourth reactor. Our shift remained on site during the tests because our replacements hadn't arrived. Everything was going fine and all the tests were completed, except for the last one. At that moment, there were two powerful shock waves, the second was much stronger than the first one. Dust rose up around the control room, and then everything went quiet, well, at first, it was not clear what happened. I was probably only about thirty metres from the reactor. I ran into the room - the Block Control room is located between the turbine hall and the reactor room, and saw this: the lights were out, short circuit flashes were coming from the on-site feed pumps followed by steam and a strong burning smell.
Holy cow.

I ran to the fourth reactor control room, the room was a mess, Tregub, the shift supervisor, ran to manually open the valves of the reactor cooling system, deciding it was urgent to apply water to the reactor, so I tagged along, to help. We rushed out into the corridor, where the annex was located. We ran up the stairs. There were blue fumes hanging in the air, strange... we didn't pay much attention to it, because we didn't yet understood how serious this was... after inhaling these fumes , as we reached the 27th step, we could feel a strong metal taste in our mouths. But not below that. It happened suddenly. Tregub ran ahead, he knew this place like the back of his hand. There was a wooden door. He grabbed for it - apparently it was swollen - and wouldn't give! We wanted to enter, but couldn't - and it was impossible to stay there. We went back to try to get into the turbine hall. We opened the door and saw the hall was piled high with debris, and the roof was gone...
Yeah, that's a picture.

The Turbine Hall roof had collapsed - as if hit by something ... I could see the stars in the sky through the hole, under my feet were pieces of the roof, and black bitumen, so... so dusty. I thought - wow ... what's all this dust? Is this - bitumen coating dried up by the sun? It's not usually dusty. Or insulation so dry that it turned to dust? Only then I realized. It was graphite. From the reactor. Then I spun round - opened all the valves, then rushed outside to see what had happened, well because, from in here you couldn't tell. Outside, everything was covered with graphite. And over the fourth reactor, was a luminescence. It was bright blue. In general, I inhaled a very decent dose. Well, it became clear that everything was very bad. I called Tanya that afternoon, I told her to close all the windows of the house and not to leave for any reason. In the evening of that day I became ill, my mind was swimming and I was taken away by ambulance.
You don't mess with radiation.

Immediately the next day I was transferred with the others to the City Clinical Hospital №6 in Moscow, by then I almost couldn't see straight. It saved me as a result. While I was recovering, my daughter was home alone, and now, I cannot return home. I was in a coma for almost four days. I asked about her when I awoke, it was said the entire city was evacuated, but I never found my daughter after I recovered. I searched and rummaged all papers - she didn't get out of the city with the rest, she was never evacuated. She's probably frightened... And hiding, that's why she was never found. I've been looking for her since and I won't stop until I die. I came to the Zone to find her... or, at least, her remains. Or maybe she's still alive, and I will be lucky enough to see her again! It will remove a burden from the soul of an old man...
Hmm, well, a sad story. Accept my condolences.
Look, stalker, will you help me in my search?
No, Grandpa, don't be angry.
I will help. Tell me, where do I look? Just approximately?
It's a pity, a real pity. Well, okay then.

I'll write you the address of the apartment where I lived with my daughter. I think there should still be some traces of her left. Go, see what's there. If you find anything - bring it to me. Well, you'll help, huh? I probably won't be able to get there anyway. Only don't get angry with me son, I can't offer you a reward, I have nothing except old rifles.
No, Pripyat - is a very dangerous place, and I want to live.
Well, I'll try to find something. Don't leave camp and don't get involved, I'll be back.
Hi, Grandpa! It's about your daughter.
Did you find out anything? Did you go to Pripyat? Did you find something?
No, I haven't been there yet.
Yes, I went to Pripyat and was in your apartment.
Well, what did you see? Come on, speak up, don't keep me in suspense.
The room was empty, I found nothing.

Your daughter kept a diary in the notebook, it seems they took her out after all, only not with the main group, but separately, a week later. She received a decent dose of radiation. She could still be alive.
It's a pity... I was hoping that there was something there. Okay, thank you stalker, you helped all you could. I'll have to keep scouring the archives.

Oh-oh ... if this is so, my Tanya was most likely taken to the military hospital and then probably also sent to the City Clinical Hospital №6 in Moscow, not to the same wards where we adults were brought, but somewhere in the nursery. But that was then... It's necessary to go to Moscow, to search the archives of the children's hospitals. At least I have some hope now, maybe I'll even see her again in my old age. Thank you, stalker. You helped me a lot, you've removed a burden from my mind. If she's still alive, she'd be forty now. I was a fool, I spent almost thirty years trying to turn up documents about the evacuation, going to cities where people were taken, and find out whether Tanya was there. I poked around in despair...\nWell, it's time for me to leave. I found out everything I could... Thank you once again stalker, for respecting an old man's wishes, you have no idea how important this was to me... Stay safe in the Zone, son.

Goodbye, Grandpa, I was glad to help you. You'll see, you'll meet up with her, something tells me that she is still alive. Look, take the doll with you, don't lose it. Just don't show anyone. It lay in the zone for a long time, it seems to me it could be useful to you in your quest.
The Zone is favourable to those who selflessly do good deeds.\nNow you can sleep in the rain and without protection.\nThe Zone will safeguard you from cold and danger as you sleep.
Comrade General, have you never tried to negotiate with Freedom?

Yes, we've already tried. But unfortunately, the meeting with Lukash frustrated me at times for various reasons. When the emission began, one of theirs seized one of our fighters, then the opposite happened, and one thing lead to another. In general, an agreement was never reached. Why do you ask?
I can help you arrange another meeting with the leader of the Freedom. If you can negotiate with each other, then it will be easier for all of us to live...

Well, life is certainly easy, in addition to our encounters, we have plenty of other misfortunes. The monsters, those lousy fucking monolith fanatics, emissions and God knows what else the Zone can throw at us. I need to have a long talk with Lukash! Well, Strelok, try to arrange a meeting. But only on neutral territory. For example, the abandoned farm at the Army Warehouses. I'll take care of the protection, and you work as the peace envoy.
Well, then I'm gone.
Oh, no reason, just asking.
I want to arrange a meeting between you and Voronin. What do you think?
Ummm... Marked One, I don't know what to say. I would have shot you for your silly joke, but you look painfully serious. Are you kidding me?
By no means, I don't kid. Agree? I talked with Duty - they don't mind, they wanted to talk with you for a long time.

Well, actually, yes, then I agree. To be at war on two fronts - is not good business. The fanatics constantly break through the Northern checkpoint, our people have already put down fuck knows how many, but they keep coming. Thank you for organizing the meeting, although unexpectedly. Take something from me in gratitude. Only look - it seems you're honest, but if it's a trap - the revenge will be terrible, believe me.
Don't worry, I'm honest. The meeting will be at the abandoned farm, not far from here - on neutral territory.
All's well, Lukash agreed to the meeting.
Thank you, Marked One, for organizing the meeting. Here, take this small reward.
Phew, at least it's safe on the rocks. Stalker, I'm lucky that you were here. Listen, I'm low on cartridges and I still need to get out of here. Can you help me?
I will. I came for you.
You were probably sent by Lukash, right? Just wait a moment, I'll go and remove the recorder from the helicopter. It will only take a minute, then we can go.
Uh-huh.
Well, did you get the recorder? Then let's go.
Got it. We can go now. Take me to the transition to the Army Warehouses, I can manage on my own after that.
Stalker, this is our territory, leave quickly!
Freedom? Here? What are you doing here?
We are no longer members of Freedom. We recently left the group. We kept the Freedom body armour because that's all we had.
Well, I'll go then.
Why are you keeping those stalkers in the car? Who are they?

Yes, they wandered near here, well, we met and talked with them. It turned out they were working for Barkeep - leaking information to him about what is happening. Well, we tied them and - tried to shake out some information about Duty. And at the same time, since they're our prisoners, we'll force them to get to us artifacts from that low tower over there. There should be some Mama's Beads there. It's as radioactive as like hell, but they have nothing to lose. If you try to interfere - you will be shot.
I never thought that Freedom could be so cruel. Can you let them go?
I told you, we're not Freedom any more. Whether or not we release them - is our business, okay? And anyway, why am I talking to you? Get the hell out of here before I put a hole in your head!
What if you let me go up there, bring you the artifact, and you let them go?
Why would you do that?
What can I say, I have business with them.
Well, no problem. For now, the bullet will have to wait.
I'm going.
Did you bring the artifact?
Not yet.
Yes, here it is, take it.
Yeah, I'll take it.\nThat's all, you can go now.
Um, but what about our bargain?

What bargain? What are you talking about? I don't know anything about it. Get out of here while you can before you get a bullet to the head. I repeat - you're free to go. Hurry, while you're still in one piece.
Well okay, okay...
Stalker, piss off. We won't tolerate having you here.
I'm going, going, going ...

Hey stalker, come here. Hush-up, speak softly, so as we don't alert them. Hey, help us out, we're in deep shit. These crazy Freedom renegades won't let us live. They have planted explosives in the car, so we don't try to escape. Damn, we don't know what to do. Help us out stalker, and we will return the favour. Do something, please, we want to stay alive.
Well, I'll try to help.
Phew, thank you! So, can you get me a firearm and necessary ammunition for it? If we break out, it will be easier to do with a weapon. What about it?
[Take the weapon from the first slot]
[Tahe the weapon from the second slot]
Wait, have a look at what I can give you...
Have you decided what weapon to give me? If yes, then let's do it quickly - every second counts.
Sorry, but I can't give you anything - I need it.
Well, I'm waiting.
Well, how soon before you begin the assault?
I'm on my way.
Okay, when you distract them, we'll begin our escape. I'll help you with cover fire, so don't worry. Phew, we'll get through this...
It's a pity that you have no weapons. Well, as soon as you distract the renegades, we will start to run. I hope that everything works out...
God help us...
We'll break out when you start firing. Thanks again for having responded! Don't wait for us, go, quickly.
Well, it seems we beat them.
It's my pleasure. Always happy to help.

Thank you, stalker, you helped us a lot. Now I'm nothing you can repay, but the bartender you for saving me roll away the good reward. Well, I can get to the Bar on my own.\nThanks again for saving me!
Hi, Marked One!
Thank you, Marked One, for saving my friend. I really thought it was curtains for him. Take this well earned reward.
I came from Barkeep about the deal with the mercenaries.

Yes, Barkeep warned me. In general: Go to the meeting with the squad, I threw the coordinates on your PDA. You have to play the role of a sniper and help if they come fire. The main thing - try to protect the captured commander. Got it?
Yes, I understood.
Enable

Gasoline? Well, you can try and search the old warehouses... or ask the military. But remember, the warehouses were plundered10 years ago and trying to get something from the military - is like asking a zombie for a cigarette. Although, if you want, I can help you out - I know where you can find a canister. I'm willing to share the information.

The gasoline can be found near the old grain elevator, there is an old warehouse there or whatever it was. Look around in the corner of the building near a pile of wooden boxes. That's where a stalker hid a can of gasoline. In fact, the Zone claimed this stalker, so you can safely take it.
Find the unknown artifact
Sakharov asked me to go to the Darkscape and try to get an unusual artifact that was found there not so long ago. True, it's a long way to go, and who knows what's waiting for me...
Find and try to pick up the artifact
Go and talk with Sakharov
Examine the unknown artifact

A strange artifact has appeared in the Darkscape, which runs from the pursuer. I need to catch it and examine it with the Special artifacts Analyser. According to Sakharov, the artifact is located south of the mountain range, in the woods west of the mill.
Examine the artifact with the SAA

Sakharov gave me a bag with unknown alloy inside, which theoretically could stifle the properties of the artifact. It's better not to handle it at all. It is necessary to put the case on the ground and drive the artifact into it. Well, try to...
Get the unknown artifact
Catch the artifact with "Prudenko's isolator" case
Defector
Help the deserter
Find deserter some clothing
Find a report about the transition
Return to the deserter
Reach Sidorovich
Talk to the deserter

The deserter, the poor fellow asked me to take him to the Cordon and put in a word for him with Sidorovich. But above all, in order not to attract too much attention, he needs a change of clothing. A plain Stalker jacket or suit will do. Also it's necessary to remember to pick up the documents that will help you find the transition between the Agroprom and the Cordon.
Reconnaissance report

Commander
Special Security Battalion
Zone Perimeter
About the isthmus Osadchenko A.G.
 
Commander of the 2nd Company
S/isthmus Kahn V.I.
 
REPORT
 
I want bring to your attention that in the course of verification of the information obtained by our aerial reconnaissance, the presence of a terrestrial passage south-east from the "Agroprom" complex to the area near the destroyed railway bridge, has been established.
